title.rendered: Australian Government Recruitment for Construction Workers (Free Visa + $10k)

content.rendered:
The Australian Government is pleased to introduce a recruitment program to alleviate labour shortages in the country’s construction industry. The Construction Visa Subsidy Program (CVSP) initiative is available to construction workers ready to relocate to Australia.

Through the CVSP, candidates can access free visa support services and are eligible to receive financial incentives of up to 10,000 Australian dollars. These incentives are intended to motivate and streamline the process of construction workers relocating from other countries to Australia, where they can fill crucial positions in the construction industry.

The Australian Construction Visa Subsidy Program:

The recently launched Construction Visa Subsidy Program (CVSP) is a significant initiative by the Australian Government, specifically focusing on helping Western Australian construction companies address their skilled labour requirements.

This program will provide up to $10,000 in financial support to facilitate skilled migration visa pathways for workers. It aims to alleviate various costs, including migration agent fees, visa application fees, and expenses associated with relocation.

The program offers two distinct pathways: one for WA employers (CVSP Employer Sponsored Stream) and another for independent skilled migrants (CVSP State Nominated Stream).

Eligibility Criteria

The following are the eligibility criteria for the Australian Government Recruitment of Construction Workers:

  • Be sponsored by a CVSP employer as a skilled migrant in one of the following visa subclasses: 482, 494 or 186;
  • A sponsored CVSP employer must be headquartered in Western Australia and undertake building and construction work.
  • Be granted a visa through the WA State Nominated Migration Program (SNMP) in one of the following visa subclasses: 190 or 491;
  • Be employed by a business headquartered and undertaking building and construction work in WA and
  • working in an eligible occupation.

Application Procedures

How-to-Apply: Interested applicants for the Australian Government Recruitment for Construction Workers are to follow the following steps to apply:

Step 1

Lodge an Expression of Interest in SkillSelect to indicate your interest in WA State Nomination.

Step 2

If you have not already been linked with an eligible WA employer, you can enter your details in the Skilled Migrant Employment Register (SMER).

Step 3

Once you have been approved for State Nomination and your visa has been granted by the Commonwealth’s Department of Home Affairs, register your arrival and visa approval with Migration Services.

Step 4

When you have commenced employment with an eligible employer and received your first payslip, complete the CVSP State Nominated Stream – Milestone 1 – Claim Form to receive your first payment.

Step 5

When you have completed six months of work in WA’s construction industry, complete the CVSP State Nominated Stream – Milestone 2 – Claim Form to receive your final payment.

Application Deadline: Not specified
